Pleased with his substance for the evening, Simon moved to return to his homework. Only to be unaware of the events set in motion.
12522211.title: The Strange Tea

choices: Wendy finds out he was drinking tea.
Kim notices something odd about him.
Simon drinks even tea later.
125222111.content:
Somewhere in the wee hours of the morning, Simon passed out while burning the midnight oil. Essay written and belly warm from some surprisingly good tea.

It was around noon when Simon stirred again, head slammed against his desk and an evergrowing drool puddle next to his books.

He blinked a few times as he stared off into the clock on his cellphone, slowly processing what that meant until it hit him like an ice cube sliding down his back.

"Oh, shit! I'm going to be late for class!"

He scrambled to his feet and made for his bedroom to get changed to catch his bus. Throwing off his loose fitting pajamas, Simon was surprised to find that he had a tiny pot belly growing underneath his shirt.

"I gotta lay off all the pizza."

Of course, this was a bit more unusual than what Simon's comments let on. Simon was always a spectacularly average man. Standing at 5'10 and being 162 pounds, he was of slim build and basic stature. He had fair brown hair and simple features with nothing in particular that made him stand out.

However, in the course of one night, Simon had put on a whopping fifteen pounds like he was experiencing the freshman fifteen again. This was in addition to a drop in two inches of height, making Simon both slightly smaller but that much larger, by perspective at 5'8 and 177 pounds.

Despite that, he was content with ignoring all that and continuing along his merry way. He would exercise later and forget all about it. He didn't even think it was weird that his jeans felt a little long on him while the waist cut into his gut. There were more important things to worry about, like exams.

But he was about to have more to worry about.
125222111.title: A Slow Change

choices: Wendy offers Simon more tea as an experiment.
Wendy comes clean and requests compensation for the tea.
Wendy punishes Simon in other ways.
1252221111.content:
It was a weird day, with Simon feeling like he was constantly uncomfortable in his own clothes. At one point, he even had to undo the top button of his pants to let his stomach breathe. But it wasn't without good things too. Despite the pop quiz he faced in statistics, he found himself passing it with surprising ease.

It was as if he was feeling slightly smarter than usual, even with the late night he had beforehand.

But, of course, the day eventually ended with even more homework to do and tests to study for. Simon had a weird craving for the tea he had tried the night before. It's odd flavor was on the tip of his tongue as he stepped inside for the night.

"Maybe I can order a pizza too..."

It was a surprise to find that Wendy was also home, having just arrived from whatever her day job was. She looked fairly dressed up like she had been out on the town, outfit exposing just the right amount of cleavage to cause Simon to look the other way.

"Hey Simon," she said with a pleased tone. "Everything good? You look a little...Sick?"

"Weird day," he replied, throwing his bag down and digging out his cellphone. "But I feel fine. I'm ordering a pizza, you want anything?"

"Oooh. Let me dig up my purse."

"Nah, my treat," he said.

Truthfully, he was feeling a little guilty about her tea and was trying to make amends in a subtle way.

He was completely unaware that Wendy had already gone into the cabinet and seen one of her teabags missing. She kept a perfect count of everything she owned, after all. If Simon had been paying attention while he dialed, he might have noticed Wendy staring right at him. Studying him, almost.
1252221111.title: Wendy is Aware

choices: Simon is now cursed like that forever.
Wendy wants to experiment with the tea to see what happens.
There's a cure, but it will take a while to craft.
12522211112.content:
While they waited for their pizzas, Wendy calmly started cooking up some of her tea. She continued to study Simon out of the corner of her eye. He was playing on his phone and not paying her much mind, though still shifting uncomfortably in his clothes. He only looked up when Wendy approached him with two cups of tea.

"Here," she said with a coy smile. "I made some for you since you're treating."

"Oh," Simon accepted the cup. "Thanks! What, uh, what is this if you don't mind me asking?"

"Just a special little recipe I have. You've been getting into it, haven't you?"

"What? I mean...No...How could you tell?"

She just laughed and said. "That was my one rule for living here, so of course I was going to keep track of it. Do you have any idea what this is?"

"Uh...Damn good tea?"

"You really haven't noticed?"

"Noticed what?"

"Wow, you are even more oblivious than my last boyfriend. Just drink the tea and observe yourself for a moment."

Simon gave her a furrowed brow and then looked closer at the cup of tea in his hand. It looked the same as it did last night, nothing different with its dull crimson color. He only drank it when he saw Wendy do the same, confirming that it wasn't poison.

Sure enough it tasted no different than the night before. Same lavender taste that was strangely sweet and comforting. He finished the whole cup before Wendy could even down three sips.

"So," continued Simon. "What are you going on about?"

"Stand up for a moment."

Simon obeyed and immediately was overcome by a sense of lightheadedness. He had been sitting before when he had first tried the tea and much too distracted with his homework to fully notice the changes that happened.

There was the sound of bones rearranging themselves as Simon first noticed his level of perspective was slightly diminishing. Or rather, he first thought Wendy was growing. She had gone from his chest level to just under his chin as he dropped to around 5'6, getting rather short for a guy his age. His clothes became looser, though his bloated gut prevented his jeans from sliding off. The neck of his T-shirt was starting to show his shoulder.

The sensation of feeling drained was completely overcome by a very filling impression, like Simon had just eaten a large meal.

His hands pressed against his stomach as it bloated outwards, popping the button of his jeans. His thighs began to swell too, as did his entire bottom making it feel quite cramped in his pants indeed. The fainted tearing could be heard as the seams can a little undone. Overall, his entire weight plumpened up to 198 pounds, with most of that settling in below his waist.

Wendy stood by, calmly sipping at her tea and watching Simon. "Fascinating."

"What...What just happened to me?" Simon cried, lifting up his shirt and looking at his new pudge. "I'm a whale!"

"Hey now, you're just fine. Just getting the curves in all the right places."

"Why? Why did this happen?"

"I warned you about touching my stuff, didn't I? Call this compensation for breaking my one rule. You're lucky that this is all that's going to happen to you."

There were many things that Simon could ask about his predicament, but he started with the most pressing on his lips.

"How?"

"Well," Wendy gave him another smirk. "I was going to save this until at least a month of living together and introduce the concept to you slowly. But I'm kind of a witch, Simon."

"A witch?"

"Yup. Surprise. That's kind of why I had to look for a new place after things didn't exactly go well with my boyfriend. And after I just got settled in this place, I have no desire to pack up and leave again."

"A witch," Simon repeated as his mind tried to adjust to the fact that such a person could exist. "Well, can you change me back if you're a witch?"

"I'm afraid I can't do that, Simon."

"Why not?"
12522211112.title: Wendy the Witch

choices: Wendy has Simon drink more tea to awaken his magic sooner.
Wendy takes it slow with Simon's changes.
Wendy wants to study the tea more.
125222111123.content:
"Let me tell you what you've been ingesting," continued Wendy as she continued to patiently sip at her tea. "In order cast spells, a witch requires some sort of essence of magic to draw from. Call it mana, if you will. But it needs to have some of 'me' added to it in order to smooth the process and let me absorb it easier."

"So, what does that mean?"

"Well, by drinking my tea, Simon, you've slowly begun to absorb my very essence. And your body has begun to change to reflect that."

"So, I'm becoming you?"

"In a sense," she shrugged. "It's more so you're taking on attributes of me. You won't actually become my clone, I think. But we could be mistaken for sisters."

"So, why are you having me drink this more?" Simon asked, staring into his empty cup.

"Part punishment. Firstly, his stuff isn't exactly easy to acquire, Simon. Secondly, because I needed to confirm that was what happened. This has never really happened before, to my knowledge. I needed to see the occurrence with my own eyes to fully understand what was going on. And thirdly, I'm going to need a little help creating the elixir to bring you back to normal."

"What do you mean? You're a witch, right? Can't you just magic it up?"

"It's not that simple, Simon. I'm a solo witch without a coven, meaning big spells and enchantments take a long time for me to conjure. Do you want to wait a full year to get back to normal?"

Simon didn't even have to think about it. "No..."

"Then I'm going to need your help with this to make it go faster. Call it the cost of touching my stuff as well as an experiment to see what happens. I'm curious too what the final result will be."

Simon couldn't help but gulp at that statement. Despite still towering over her, Wendy was starting to feel very imposing indeed.

"Alright," he said. "I'll do whatever you want then to get back to normal."

"Funny how you think you have a choice," replied Wendy. "But we'll be in agreement then. You help me fix this and I'll get you back to your old self. We'd best get started then."
125222111123.title: The "Deal"

choices: Wendy prepares an illusion for Simon.
Wendy will go to classes as Simon.
Wendy will erase Simon from memory (temporarily, hopefully).
1252221111232.content:
"Right," said Simon, shifting around on his feet uncomfortable at the prospect of slowly becoming like Wendy. "Well, what do we do first?"

Before Wendy could answer him there was a knock at the door.

"Pizza!" shouted the pizza guy on the other side.

"For starters, can you get that?" Wendy asked as she got up and waddled to her bedroom. "I have some things to take care of first. And you promised it was your treat."

Simon sighed in defeat and adjusted his shirt. He looked like a mess, given everything he was wearing was a mismatch and falling apart at the seams. The pizza guy certainly gave him a strange look and Simon could have sworn he heard "should you really be eating pizza" behind the door as he left. It's not my fault I pissed off a witch, guy.

When Simon returned to the kitchen with both pies, Wendy also arrived with her own package in tow.

"Here," she said. "You looked a little uncomfortable in all that."

Wendy offered him a pair of her own oversized sweatpants and a T-shirt to match. While it was true that Simon's jeans had exploded and his own shirt was much too big for him, he wasn't exactly excited at the prospect of dressing up in Wendy's own clothes.

"You've got to be kidding me."

"It's only going to get worse from here, Simon. You might as well get used to it. These are too big for me, but they should work just fine for you."

He groaned but traded the pizza to Wendy for the leisure outfit, scuffling off into the bathroom. Once there, he could assess the damage done to his own clothes, and his body.

With the last cup of tea, his lower half had ballooned outwards giving him a distinct pear shape, though still nowhere near as wide as Wendy. He had to be mindful where he was turning, unused to the extra inches on his backside bumping into things. Removing his jeans, he found his boxers still holding up the fight and decided to leave them on. The jeans, however, were totally destroyed with the front button missing and the seam on the butt torn.

The sweatpants Wendy had provided him were, at least, neutral grey in color and looks. They came up a little short on his ankles, though he dreaded the thought of them coming to fit him better as time went on. But they were certainly wide enough to hold on him and he even had to tie the waist tighter despite his extra plush. He reluctantly traded his T-shirt for a smaller sized black v-neck. It left a little room in the front for where cleavage was supposed to be. Am I going to grow boobs too?

Simon returned to the kitchen to find Wendy snacking on her pie.

"See, isn't that better?"

"I guess," he admitted. "But what? I'm just going to wear your clothes while I slowly become you? Won't people notice I'm missing? And I got exams to worry about!"

"Not to worry, I already gave this some thought. It'll be simple..."
1252221111232.title: Planning a Disguise

choices: One of Simon's friends breaks the illusion.
Simon loses the amulet.
The amulet has a slight malfunction.
12522211112321.content:
"Just trust me, Simon," Wendy said with a smile as they enjoyed their dinner together. "I'll have it ready by tomorrow."

Wendy spent the remainder of the night locked up in her bedroom after that. Simon did his best to return to his studying. However, his new body was proving a bit distracting. The clothes made it a little more bearable, but he wasn't used to dealing with my cushion in his seat. His boxers continued to ride up all evening until he eventually caved and called it an early night.

The next day, Wendy was already in the kitchen, bright and early.

"There you are," Wendy chimed with a mug of tea ready. "Don't you have to get to class in an hour?"

"Are you my mother?" Simon asked, snatching the tea away. "I got plenty of time."

"Well, we still got to make sure my solution works. And something tells me you don't want to be wearing my pajamas all day, so we need to find something that will fit you. Especially after your tea."

Simon grunted and sipped down the lavender tea like he was drinking medicine.

The both of them waited patiently until he had gulped the last of it down. Wendy waddled up to him, looking a lot closer than she had just a few moments ago.

Now that he was focusing, Simon could feel the changes happen this time. It started like a warm spot in the pit of the stomach and then spread like fire through all the tips of his body. Until he felt like a toasty marshmallow, soft in the middle and being pressed down from above by a gentle, unseen force.

His field of vision dropped another couple precious inches as Wendy seemed to grow right before his eyes, reaching the bottom of his lips in height. No longer did she seem quite so tiny at his new scale of 5'4.

The rest of that lost mass did it's work filled him out. He could feel his arms and legs plumpen up and his waist widen another couple of inches until the once comfortable tie around his hips was starting to dig slightly. Most different of all was with his head, however.

"My hair," Simon said as his brow was covered in brown locks.

As he brushed it from his eyes, he found a large mop of hair waiting for him. It looked as if he had skipped getting a haircut for almost half a year. Three new inches of hair tickled the back of his neck and he brushed it aside.

"Interesting," muttered Wendy. "You appear to be taking on other traits of mine now."

"Yeah, well, can't we just have me drink a bunch of tea right now?"

"That'd be incredibly dangerous, considering I only have a cup a day myself. We continue with that until you start to develop magical aptitude and can help me with channeling."

"I'll be able to do magic?"

"Try to focus, Simon," Wendy groaned and offered him a new pile of clothes. "Here, put these on."

She provided him with some jeans that looked a little large on him, given the waistline. But Wendy also had the foresight to give him a belt to go with it. As he unraveled the pants, Simon found something else in the pile.

"What's this?" he held up what looked like an emerald amulet.

"Your charm. Put it on and come to the mirror with me."

Simon did as was told, the jeans were a little large as expected. But he imagined he would fill them up soon. He then waddled out of the bedroom with the amulet on and joined Wendy next to the mirror...Only to see his old self.

"What the...?"

"It works," Wendy smirked. "Perfect. Whoever wears that amulet will now look exactly like you as an illusion. I suppose I don't have to tell you not to lose it."

"I'm not going to," he growled. "Why not just use this to get me back to normal though?"

"As you might notice, you're not exactly normal. It's just a glamour, not a physical change. You're still you underneath it. It's not much, but it should prove enough to get you through your classes. So long as no one touches you and breaks the illusion."

Simon sighed and looked down at the piece of jewelry dangled in his loose-fitting shirt. It was all that was keeping him from soiling his reputation around school. There was no telling how his friends would react to seeing him like this and he dreaded losing the fragile thing. Or worse, breaking it.

But it would have to do until Wendy could fix things.
12522211112321.title: The Illusion

choices: The amulet absorbed Kim's appearance instead of Simon's.
The amulet absorbed Kim herself.
The amulet caused their attribute to switch.
125222111123213.content:
And so, Simon went about his day as normally as he possibly could.

That was harder than it sounded, considering he was still adjusting to his new shape and scale. Since the morning tea, his overall weight had pumped him up beyond the two hundred markers to 212, the heaviest he had ever been. And, with his shorter height to boot, Simon was feeling every bit of that extra fluff as he waddled between the classes.

Still, Wendy’s charm was doing its job. No one was batting an eye at Simon.

In fact, no one seemed to be paying him much attention at all. That had to do with the added effect Wendy had enchanted into the glamour, to prevent people from looking too closely at him.

And so, Simon continued with his classes, attempting to put the fact of slowly becoming a different person out from his mind. He found a new hobby of fiddling with his longer hair when he was bored in class, though he continued to endlessly shift around in his seat from the excess chub cushioning his bottom. He could almost swear that he was getting bigger over the course of the day.

“Just have to put up with this for like a month...Had to piss off a stupid witch.”

For some reason, class was proving to be easier than usual for Simon. He found himself grasping the lectures without having to pay much attention. Wendy’s intellect was starting to wear off on him without him even realizing it.

Though, with that, came a sense of boredom.

Simon couldn’t well play on his phone in the middle of class, so when fiddling with his hair lost his interest, he turned to the amulet instead.

It was at the end of Physic 201 that the first incident happened.

While flicking at the amulet, the green emerald suddenly started to glow. Though it wasn’t bright enough to attract attention, Simon quickly grasped it tight to hide it from sight. He smothered it in his loose fitting shirt until the bell rang and quickly excused himself from class first. Him being in a rush was his first mistake as he was so focused on escaping class, he didn’t watch where he was going.

“Hi Simon--Omph!”

Simon saw too late the average sized rack of his old roommate, Kim. Indeed, Simon found he had to be looking up at her to meet her eyes now. Though, through his error, the glowing amulet grazed Kim. Combined with his earlier fiddling, this led to a slight malfunction with the magic...
125222111123213.title: The First Incident

choices: Wendy's body absorbs Kim's mass from the amulet.
Wendy takes on Kim's appearance with the amulet.
Wendy allows Kim to manifest herself in a new way.
1252221111232132.content:
It happened in a flash of light. It was bright enough that Simon had to shield his eyes for a moment before looking to whom he had bumped into. Only to find...No one.

He could have sworn he had run head first into someone. That was when he looked down and noticed what was on the floor.

“Aren’t those Kim’s clothes?”

Simon had been roommates with Kim long enough to recognize her usual outfits. And laying on the floor, in a heap, was her jeans and the plaid button shirt he remembered her wearing a bunch of times. In addition, he spied her bra amongst the folds. That’s when his amulet started pulsing.

Behind him, people were starting to pour out of the classroom and there was no time to think here in the hallway.

Instead, Simon leaned over to gather up everything and waddled all the way home.

~

“What did you do this time?” asked Wendy.

“I didn’t do anything!” Simon protested. “I just bumped into a friend outside of a classroom and she suddenly...Vanished.”

“Let me see the necklace.”

Simon obeyed, handing over the amulet while still holding onto Kim’s clothes. The gem continued to pulse like a lighthouse as Wendy held it up by the chain.

Wendy thought for a long time before speaking.

“It looks like your friend got absorbed by the amulet.”

“What!? How?”

“You tell me. This artifact was only supposed absorb appearances for an illusion. Not absorb entire people. What were you doing to it?”

“I didn’t do anything! I was just..Fiddling with it in class and it started to glow.”

Wendy looked at Simon for a moment and sighed.

“You don’t fiddle with magical items, Simon. They’re dangerous, even the simplest ones. You need to treat them all with respect.”

“Alright, alright. But there’s a way to bring her back, right?”

“Let me think…”
1252221111232132.title: Kim Absorbed

choices: Wendy manages to calm Simon and Kim down.
Kim, in a panic, hijacks control of Simon's body and makes a run for it.
Another burst of magic changes more things when Wendy make contact with Simon.
12522211112321323.content:
Wendy stood deep in thought. Her chin rested on her closed left fist and her right hand, closed around the amulet, pressed against her left arm. This resulted in her right arm stretching under and push up her hefty cleavage. Simon could feel his face turning red as he tried - and failed - to avoid staring at her cleavage.

“I’ve got nothing,” Wendy sighed after a minute. “I’ll sleep on it and should have an idea in the mor-”

She was cut off as the little emerald on the amulet flashed bright light across the room. With the light a surge of energy, like a strong wind, swept over the room. The force buffeted Simon forcing him a step back. More importantly, he felt it change him as it poured into his body.

His body began to shift once more much more drastically this time. At this point he’d gained an additional 70 pounds and lost almost eight inches in height and his hair was longer than it’d been in ages. While this was all very drastic in and of itself, it weirdness was partially mitigated as it was spread out over the course of almost four days. However, in mere seconds, he changed even more.

His hair burst from his scalp extending well past his shoulders in waves of chestnut brown as it lightened a few shades. He felt his bones pop and shift and his muscles stretch uncomfortably as he regained some of his height, jumping back up to 5’6”. At the same time, Simon’s body surge outward swelling with additional mass. His already thick legs grew thicker, pressing together and stretching the seams of his pants. He hips bulged wider, accompanied by his back stretching further from his back, growing rounder and heavier. His round tummy surged forward, bursting the button of his pants and shooting it across the room, and oozing out in a pale jiggly sphere. His arms thickened, his hands growing pudgier and somehow daintier. Simon could feel his face shift as its structure rearranged itself into a far more feminine appearance, his lips plumping up, and his cheeks rounding and developing a double chin. Most awkwardly was his chest: it began to swell into two perky obvious breasts that he - almost shamefully - recognized from many a fantasy and oogle-ings as Kim’s.

Practically nude now, what with his growth all but destroying his clothes, and his body jiggling and looking very feminine after gaining another 125 pounds, Simon heard a voice. Not from Wendy or from the hall or from anywhere in the building but instead in his head.

“Where am I? This is my old apartment...who are you!?” Kim spoke into his mind, somehow looking through his eyes.

“Oh my god, Kim! Are you ok?!” Simon blurted to the room before clamping his hands over his mouth as he spoke in Kim’s voice, though a bit deeper. “What is happening?”


“Simon? Where are you? Why do you sound like that? Why can’t I move my body? What happened?” Kim panicked.

“Simon? Are you ok?” Wendy said, looking at him worriedly.

“I-I think Kim is in my head…” Simon muttered in shock. He was not wrong.
12522211112321323.title: Kim's Back! Sort of...

choices: Simon gets something to eat to distract himself, frustrating Kim.
Simon agrees to go see Patricia and Kim lets him get something to eat on the way
Kim overrides control and goes for the tea and Wendy's things.
125222111123213231.content:
After about half an hour of panic on everyone’s part, things had calmed down. Simon was standing in the bathroom room, examining his reflection in the mirror. He looked like a strange amalgamation of himself, Wendy, and Kim. His hair was lighter than normal but darker than Kim’s and closer to her length and style. His face was very round and feminine with chubby cheeks, a double chin, and plump seductive lips like Wendy but covered in Kim’s freckles. His left eye was dark brown, his natural color, but his right was bright blue, a dead ringer for Kim’s eye. Under it all, his general facial structure was similar to his. He could easily pass for a cousin of his.

His body was another story. He adjusted to Kim’s normal height of 5’6” and his already chubby 220 pound had bloated with an additional 125 pounds - Kim’s normal weight. He had remained definitely bottom heavy, gaining nearly all that added mass to his hips, ass, thighs, and tummy while his breasts (he had breasts!) were a dead ringer for Kim’s. Weider still, he still had his own manhood though for how long he did not know.

“So the amulet, unable to store Kim’s essence, channeled her into you,” Wendy explained once more from across the room. She was hesitant to get near him for fear that the magic may react oddly.

“So how do we fix this?” Kim asked him. Oddly enough, he had quickly adjusted to having her in his head. It felt almost natural? Simon felt that should scare him but it didn’t. It was kind of comforting having her there. Kim was rather calm as well, having been able to see his memories of the past few days to get caught up to speed.

“Kim wants to know how to fix this,” Simon relayed, stepping out of the bathroom.

“I-I have no idea,” Wendy stammered. “This has never happened before.”

“We should mess with the amulet again. If that did this, it should be able to undo it,” Kim urged.

“I don’t think that’s a good idea,” Simon told her, frowning. Seeing the confused expression on Wendy’s face, he explained Kim’s idea.

“No no no,” Wendy said shaking her head. “I’m gonna go see someone. A colleague of sorts and have them look at the amulet. Maybe they can help. Just...stay here and don’t do anything that might make this worse.”

Before Simon or Kim could protest, the very flustered Wendy had already gathered her things and left. Simon absentmindedly rubbed at his belly as it growled, hardly noticing that his weight was still ticking upward and that his lost another inch.

“I guess we should eat something then,” Simon said to the Kim.

“I’m kind of hungry too but we certainly don’t need to be eating. We’re huge,” Kim retorted, frustrated. “She’s not very good at this witch thing.”

“She’s trying,” Simon defended Wendy.

“You know, Patricia has been going through a wiccan or something phase,” Kim remembered. “Maybe she can do something.”

“I highly doubt that Patricia would know more than Wendy,” Simon laughed. “Let’s eat something.”

“Or we could drink more tea,” Kim urged. “Let’s just get this ‘transformation’ over with, go into her room and find her spellbook or whatever, and fix this ourselves!”

“That sounds like a really bad idea,” Simon worried.

“Ugh, we gotta do something other than stuff our fat face!” Kim snapped.

Simon was always rather chill, a more go with the flow kind of guy, while Kim was more assertive and wanted to get things done. What do the two of them decide on?
125222111123213231.title: Roommates Sharing a Very Different Space

choices: Eating adds more "Wendy" to the mix.
Eating causes Simon to awaken some magic.
The rolls they eat are magical.
1252221111232132312.content:
“Alright,” Simon agreed. “If we see Patricia then can we stop at the bakery or something?”

“Fine.”

A compromise. Simon and Kim were always good at finding them with each other. Though Simon was the one in control and driving, he wasn’t sure if that would always be the case. With elements of both Wendy and Kim making up his body, a part of him felt like he was fading away. Not so much that his mind was vanishing, just that it felt like there was less of him in the mix between the two girls.

He tried to pay it no mind as they dug through Wendy’s laundry pile left out in the living room during the hour they spent figuring things out. Kim helped him sort through it.

Having the weight and more weight than Wendy, most of her clothing was far too small and he felt very compacted inside them. But, eventually, they were able to find stuff that would work for the purposes of getting to Patricia.

They stuffed their wide hips and thighs into the largest pair of sweatpants they could find, though even that was a little too short as it went up past their ankles. They had to wear a bra now and Simon struggled with slipping it on while Kim guided him with instructions in their head. For shirts, Simon picked out a large hoodie that would do enough to cover them up. Nothing said “leave me alone” like sweatpants and a hoodie. For shoes, Kim’s own sneakers thankfully managed to fit on their feet which had shrunk to match her size more or less.

With an outfit sorted out, they took their first steps together out into the world as a chimera.

The first thing Simon noticed was that there was a lot more jiggling to their steps than he was used to. The second were the eyes on him. Even dressed as they were, he still sensed the lingering gaze from men they passed by. Specifically on their rump, which was almost rivaling Wendy’s in scale.

Kim seemed to sense his discomfort. “Not so easy, is it?”

“Yeah, yeah. Let’s just get some food first.”

There was a small bakery near the shopping district that Simon rarely frequented, but he knew it for the smell of fresh bread every time he passed by it while on the town. Their mouth watered as they stepped in to the scent of some baking cinnamon buns.

“Wendy?” called a voice from the counter.

The bakery was entirely empty, save for the young blonde girl working the register. She looked like a freshman in college doing her first part time to pay for classes and was quite petite. She had very little meat to her and was short. Shorter than Simon, but not as short as Wendy. But, given their increase in weight, Simon felt like three times the clerk’s size.

“Oh,” the girl said. “I’m so sorry. I thought you were my boss for a second. You kind of look like her. A little.”

“Wendy?” Simon realized what was going on. They had stumbled into where Wendy worked. “Oh, that’s because I’m...Her sister. Simone.”

It was a cosy area, obviously having been used by some previous owner of the mansion. Pushed up against the wall next to her was a wooden bench with a couple of cushions sitting atop it. On the other side was a small bookcase, which Talia had a look at. Sadly, it was empty, meaning she would probably have to find the library if she wanted a book.

"Aw, well... I suppose I could, like, try to find the library," Talia said, planting her wider backside on the bench. "Sitting out here with a nice book doesn't sound too bad... Though I could catch a cold sitting out here..."

Deciding to take her chances, Talia wandered back into the mansion. She had no idea where the library could possibly be, or even if it was on the second floor, but she now had signs on the door to help her. Hopefully, she would stumble upon the library...
14311212111112122121.title: Investigating the Interior

choices: Some sort of beauty salon...
What appeared to be a games room...
A room that looked suspiciously like a guest room...
143112121111121221212.content:
Making sure to remember where the balcony was, Talia headed back into the labyrinth of corridors that made up the mansion. After taking a few turns, she quickly realised that, even with signs on the doors, the library might be quite hard to find.

"Guest Room #34..." Talia muttered, passing another door. "God! How many guest rooms do I need?! I don't even have that many friends! Though, with this body, that could change..."

Talia lost track of time as she weaved through the long corridors. Every so often she would stumble upon a door she had already passed, which slowly began to infuriate her.

After passing by Guest Room #39 for the umpteenth time, Talia dropped and stomped her foot.
"Screw this goddamn place!" She yelled angrily. "Like, why couldn't they have just built this place normally, instead of having millions of bloody corridors for people to get lost in?!

Resisting the urge to put her foot through the door next to her, Talia resorted to just cracking her knuckles. After almost breaking her fingers, she stopped and took a deep breath.

"Okay... Let's find a room that isn't another guest room and hope that there's somebody inside that can guide me!"
With a plan sorted out, Talia continued down the corridor, nursing her fingers as she walked.

It took her a few minutes, during which she passed three guest rooms and one supply closet, but Talia eventually stumbled upon a room. Strangely, unlike all the other rooms she had seen, this one seemed to be missing the plaque telling her what kind of room it was. Instead, the door had slightly miscoloured section where the plaque should've been, along with four holes where the screw presumably where.

"Why would anybody steal the plaque?" Talia wondered, staring at the door. "Like, wow, you've slightly inconvenienced me! It's not like I can't open the door and just see what's inside!"

Pushing open the door, Talia was met with...
143112121111121221212.title: Lost, confused and angry

choices: Talia slowly drifts off to sleep...
The portrait behind the pair begins to glow...
Monica strikes up a conversation with Talia...
1431121211111212212121.content:
Poking her head into the room, Talia let out a gasp.
"Is this... a beauty salon?!" She asked excitedly, forcing her way into the room. "Like, oh my god! It is!"

Staring around, Talia jumped when she heard somebody cough.
"You must be the new owner!"
Looking towards the source of the voice, Talia found a girl, not much older than her, watching her with some amusement. Her brown hair was pulled back into a ponytail that reached partway down her back, while her servant's uniform had an apron covering it.

"Yep, that's me! The name is Talia!" Talia replied, pointing to herself. "And you are?"
"I'm Monica, and this is my salon!" Monica said. "If I'm honest, I didn't expect to see you so soon. Most people spent their first week wandering the first floor, and then they spend their second wandering the second. It's normally the third week before I get somebody in here!"

"Oh, so I'm not the only one who keeps getting lost?" Talia asked, reassured by this.
"You sure aren't! Half the people who walk in here don't actually need anything other than directions. The other half don't even realise that this is a salon, and thought it was some other room entirely!" Monica said, a smile on her face.

"Well, I did notice that you don't actually have a sign, so, like..." Talia explained, glancing back at the door.
A frown appeared on Monica's face.
"The sign isn't there? Huh, that's odd... I really don't know why somebody would take it. Thanks for bringing this to my attention, I'll get a new one made as soon as! Anyway, is there anything I can do for you?"

Talia was about to ask for directions, but stopped herself. After hearing that people walked in here for directions, she would feel guilty for doing just that. Plus, the smile on Monica's face was so hopeful, it was almost like Talia was her first visitor in forever...

"Well, I... I was thinking of getting something done..." Talia said, shutting the door behind her. "What would you recommend?"
Monica clapped happily.
"You're serious? That's great! Please, have a seat here! I'll have a quick look and see what can be done!"

Monica rushed over to a seat, pulling it out for Talia. Hesitantly, Talia headed over to it and sat down. Looking straight ahead, her reflection stared back. Her brow furrowed as she looked at her face. Had it always been that round...

"Lets see here..."
Feeling the chair pushed forwards, Talia felt Monica's gaze drill into her. Her hands ran through Talia's hair, occasionally getting caught on the knots in it.
"Hmm, hair definitely needs work..." She heard Monica mutter. "Should be simple enough..."

Monica drew back for a moment. In the mirror, Talia saw her grabbing various hair-related utensils, such as brushes, combs and a squirt bottle. As Monica stepped out of view, Talia spotted the portrait of a woman staring down at her.

"Who's that?" Talia asked, spinning the chair around to looked at the woman.
"Hm? Oh, that's Lady Samantha. Unlike the vast majority of the other rooms, we've only got one painting in here," Monica explained as she returned to Talia's side. "Apparently, she had an absolutely immaculate body. Her hair never knotted and never dried out, her skin never blemished and was always smooth... I suppose if you spent as much time in here as she did, you'd have a perfect body too!"

Staring at Lady Samantha, Talia agreed with that statement. Her blonde hair looked thick and voluminous, her lashes were long and perfect, her mocha-coloured skin looked to be free of imperfections...

Spinning her chair back around, Monica draped an apron over Talia's body. As she began to spray her hair with water, Talia relaxed. She had never had her hair done by a professional before, always electing to do it herself to save money.

Feeling a comb being gently dragged through her hair, Talia closed her eyes and let out a sigh...
1431121211111212212121.title: Meeting Monica and her Salon

choices: Talia decides to ask Monica for directions...
Talia decides to try and find it herself...
Before she can decide, Talia feels oddly tired...
14311212111112122121212.content:
Hearing Talia sigh, Monica smiled. It had been so long since she had somebody in her salon, she worried that she might have forgotten how to do anything!

Oh, she's fallen asleep! Monica realised, looking at Talia's reflection. Her eyes were closed and she was slowly inhaling through her mouth and exhaling through her nose. Well, whatever helps her relax! I hope I don't wake her while I work...

Monica went about her work, slowly becoming oblivious to her surroundings as she became more and more focused on undoing all the damage Talia had unknowingly done to her hair through her self-styling. She hummed a quiet tune as she worked, not noticing the frame behind her shimmer slightly.

From the frame fell a beautiful ghost clothes in a long flowing dress. She ran her hands through her hand before inhaling deeply.
Ah, it feels sublime to be free of that frame! She thought, looking around. I see that the salon hasn't changed much... However...

Samantha silently floated behind Monica. She watched as Monica went about her work, undoing knots and wrestling with matted patches.
Oh, dear... Samantha tutted quietly. Your technique leaves much to be desired! Of course, it isn't all your fault. I suppose your model never really cared for her hair... Perhaps I could lend a hand?

Samantha slowly floated towards Monica, a grin appearing on her perfect face...
"Oh!"
Monica froze as she felt a chill penetrate her body. Her comb fell to the ground with a clatter, causing the slumbering Talia to twitch slightly.

As the chill slowly receded from her body, Monica looked around.
"W-What's going... on..." She mumbled as her eyes slowly shut. A second later, they reopened. However, instead of their usual warm brown, they were a piercing blue.

"I won't be able to stay in her body for long..." Monica said, her voice monotone. "I should work quickly..."
Picking up her fallen comb, 'Monica' resumed her work. However, her movements were more precise. She dragged the comb through Talia's hair with ease, quickly undoing all the knots.

"Perfect... Now, a little water..."
Spraying water through her hair, 'Monica' nodded. She hadn't done this for centuries, but it seemed she still had it. Finishing with the water, Samantha considered finishing, but she stopped herself when she spotted a scar running down the back of Talia's neck.

"Now, we can't have that, can we?"
Heading over to the area where Monica kept her supplies, Samantha rummaged through them. After a few seconds, she made a face.
"You don't have what I need!" She complained. "Back in my day, we could do literally anything in here! You could barely fix this woman's hair with the stuff you have now!"

Letting out a growl, Samantha forced her body to spin.
"I suppose if you want something done correctly, you do it yourself!"
Floating out of Monica's body, who collapsed to the floor unconscious, Samantha floated over to Talia.

"Now, you had better not ruin what I'm about to do for you..." She whispered in Talia's ear. "Otherwise, I'll hunt you down when you inevitably pass onto the next life..."

Taking a deep breath, Samantha floated into Talia's resting form and released her power. Letting out her last breath, Samantha slowly faded away, releasing her essence into Talia's body...

As Samantha passed on, Talia's plump body began to change. Her ivory skin slowly darkened, taking on a light mocha hue. The small scar on her neck around the one Samantha hadn't seen running down her leg vanished, leaving behind smooth skin. Her hair, which had only been half done, finished itself. The remaining knots undid themselves, while the ragged parts became silky and full.

As Talia's changes came to an end, Monica sat up. She rubbed the back of her head, gazing around the room.
"That was... odd..." She groaned, getting to her feet. "I feel really cold..."
Walking over to Talia, Monica looked down at her with confusion.

"I don't remember finishing this..." Monica said, running her hands through Talia's hair. As she did, Talia awoke with a start, causing Monica to jump back.

"Huh?!"
"Ah!"
Looking over at Monica, Talia let out a sigh.
"Oh, it's you... I thought, like, something was crawling through my hair..."

Monica smiled nervously.
"It was just me... finishing off!" She made up. "What do you think?"
Turning to face herself, Talia inspected her reflection.

"Did you do something to my skin?" Talia asked, rubbing her darker arms.
"Y-Yeah! Thought I'd try out a new spray tan I got!" Monica lied, forcing a smile onto her face. She didn't have the courage to just say that she had no idea what had happened. What if Talia never came back?

"Huh... Well, it looks great!" Talia enthused. "Like, I'll definitely be back!"
Letting out a relieved sigh, Monica bowed.
"Then I'll look forward to your next visit!" She said.

Leaving the salon, Talia fiddled with her soft hair.
"So nice..." She murmured. "But I didn't find the library... Should I, like, just ask? I don't really want to, just in case she figures me out..."
14311212111112122121212.title: Lady Samantha, the beautiful ancestor...

choices: Talia feels an odd compulsion to inspect a small section on pregnancy...
Talia spots an intriguing section about cooking and food...
Talia spots a dusty time with her family name stamped on the spine...
143112121111121221212121.content:
Unwilling to wander the mansion for another day, Talia returned to Monica's unmarked door. Her hand hovered over the door, ready to know. After a moment's hesitation, she gently rapped the door and walked in.

Monica had returned to her desk, apparently having just finished cleaning. She looked up as the door opened, a smile appearing on her face as Talia slowly edged in.
"Back so soon?" She asked jokingly. "Was it my charm that brought you back to me, or my excellent work?"

"A mix of both, I guess..." Talia answered sheepishly. For the briefest of moments, she considered asking if Monica could do anything else to her, but she quickly remembered why she had returned in the first place. "Um, like... I was wondering about something..."

"And what would that be?" Monica prompted.
Clearing her throat, Talia spoke up, confidence filling her voice.
"I was curious about the rooms in the mansion and was, like, wondering if there was a library somewhere?"

Monica leaned back in her chair, her eyes looking up at the ceiling.
"Library, huh..." She repeated quietly. "Before I answer, can I ask you something?"
"Of course! Anything you need!"

"You got lost looking for the library, didn't you?" Monica guessed, a sad smile on her face. "And you came in here, not because you wanted something done with your hair, but because you wanted directions to the library. And you stayed because my story about everybody ignoring this room made you feel guilty. Am I right?"

Talia stared down at her breasts, a nervous look on her face.
Man, she's really good at guessing... She thought. I don't really want to break her heart or anything...

"It's okay, Talia!" Monica said, a hint of happiness entering her voice. "Unlike everybody else who immediately left after getting directions, you stayed! You let me, uh... work on your hair! Tan your skin! And, um... Well, what I'm trying to say is, I really appreciate it. So, I'll happily give you directions! As long as you promise to come back?"

The pair looked at each other for a few seconds, before massive grins adorned their faces.
"Like, of course I will, Monica!" Talia promised. "You did some totally amazing work, and you can bet I'll be back! On one condition, though..."
Monica raised an eyebrow.
"Like, get a new sign so I know where you are?"

After receiving directions from Monica, Talia hugged her new best friend and set out. She took one wrong turn, which thankfully led her to a dead end rather than another junction, but aside from that mistake, Talia found herself soon standing outside a door with a plaque reading 'Second Floor Library'.

"Finally!" She exclaimed, pushing open the door. "I can't wait to see what books-"
"QUIET IN THE LIBRARY!"
Talia let out a squeak as a loud voice cut her off. A few seconds later, a rather small man appeared in front of her, an irritated expression in his face.

"I'll have no noise in my library!" He grumbled, glaring at Talia. "I don't care if you're the new owner or not! Silence in my library! Pick your books quietly, then clear off!"

"I, uh... Sorry?" Talia said quietly. His accusatory glare softened slightly as he let out a sigh.
"Sorry 'bout that... I ain't used to having people in here," He explained, walking over to a deal that was about the same height as him. "I'm William, but everybody just calls me Bill. Pleasure to meet you".

"Like, a pleasure to meet you too!" Talia bowed slightly.
"Uh-huh. Now, a few rules. I want no damage to these books. You'll be charged if there is any. Also, make sure to return them to either this library or the one on the first floor. I don't want to have to go hunting for books, you got me?"

Talia nodded.
"Good. Now, can I help you find something, or are you just browsing?"
"Guess I'm just browsing at the moment!" Talia replied. "But, like, thanks for the offer, Bill!"

Bill grunted before disappearing behind his desk, leaving Talia to stare in amazement at the ceiling high shelves filled with books.
"Like, where do I even start?" She wondered, looking around. Each aisle seemed to have a plaque telling her what kind of books she would find find. From where she was, she had a decent grasp of what kind of aisles there was...
143112121111121221212121.title: Finally finding the library...

choices: Beside her, the picture book begins to glow...
As she reads,Talia's head begins to feel odd...
Talia spends the rest of her day reading...
1431121211111212212121211.content:
Staring down a few of the aisles closest to her, Talia let out a thoughtful sigh. She really ought to find some books pertaining to her college studies, however she really wasn't feeling studying. She wanted to kick back on the balcony with a a nice book, rain gently tapping the wooden roof above her...

Moving towards an aisle that seemed to be marked 'History', Talia quickly stopped. An odd tugging on her gut seemed to be guiding her elsewhere...
"I wonder what's over here?"
Following her gut feeling, Talia found herself standing in front of a small bookcase, barely tall enough to reach her waist.

Despite the small case, Talia got on her knees, her dress spreading around her. The case held about ten books, the titles of which all involving pregnancy in some way.
"Hmmm... Pregnancy and your Body... The Mind of a Mother... Like, these don't seem like my kinda books..."

Even as she thought this, her arm was reaching out to grab one of the books. Bringing it up to her face, Talia quickly scanned the blurb.
"Thinking of bringing new life into this world?" She read quietly. "Worried about the changes to your body as you do so? Well, worry no more! This book explains all that will happen to you as your child grows within you! From morning sickness to cravings, we'll cover it all!"

Flipping the book over, Talia stared at the cover. A pregnant woman cradling her pregnant belly with one hand and holding a baby in the other smiled back at her.

Despite believing herself not pregnant and having no plans for children in her near future, Talia wanted to put the book back. However, something compelled her to keep hold of it and grab another couple. One seemed to be about the foods a pregnant woman could eat that would benefit their child the best, while the other looked like a weird picture book detailing the various stages of pregnancy.

Somewhat confused by her choice of books, Talia stood up. Putting them under her arms, she headed over to the desk where Bill was hidden.
"Um, Bill?" She called out, unable to see the small man over the books stacked high around his desk.

A grunt answered her.
"Do I need to let you know that I'm, like, taking these?" She asked, holding a book high above her head so Bill could see.
"Nah. Just bring 'em back when you're done," Bill answered shortly.

Putting the book back under her arm, Talia left the library. Pausing outside the door, she did her best to recall the way to the balcony.
"Let's see... Left? No, right!"
Nodding to herself, Talia took off, confident in her choice.

Thankfully, Talia chose correctly. She found herself standing at the balcony door, rain droplets slowly sliding down the glass. Pushing open the door, she listened to the rain for a few seconds before heading out and taking a seat on the bench.

Dropping the books next to her, Talia grabbed one at random. Looking at it, she found that she had grabbed the pregnancy picture book.
"Well, let's have a look!"

Flipping open to the first page, she spotted a neat message written in the corner.
"Lady Lucy during her first pregnancy..."
Looking at the next page, Talia got a good look at Lucy.

She was a pretty girl. She didn't have the curves of Lady Amelia, not was her skin and body as immaculate as Lady Samantha's, but she was still good-looking. Her blonde hair was pulled up into an elaborate up-do, while her green eyes stared kindly at Talia.

Turning to the next page, Talia saw Lucy sitting in the same position. However, her hands were now folded over her belly, which had a noticeable curve to it. Her breasts were slightly rounder, and she almost seemed to have a healthy glow surrounding her.

Talia flipped through the rest of the book, stopping to admire Lucy on every page. With each page that was turned, she looked more and more pregnant. Her belly grew rounder and rounder, her breasts looked heavier and heavier and even her face took on a softer look.

Turning to the final page, Talia let out a coo of happiness. Lucy had lost all of her former weight, looking almost as she did in the first picture, however she now held a bundle of blankets in her arms. A small face was visible, their eyes wide and curious.

"Like, they look so happy together!" Talia commented. "Oh? What's this?"
Spotting another message in the same neat hand, Talia leaned in.
"Lady Lucy and Sir Benjamin. Here's to the first of many!"

Leaning back, Talia smiled down at the pair. Closing the book, she gently set it to the side and grabbed another book. This one was a lot more dense than the simple picture book, but even so, it didn't take long for Talia to become fully engrossed in it...
1431121211111212212121211.title: Researching pregnancy

choices: Frozen by fear, Talia is unable to move...
Finding the door handle, Talia escapes the balcony...
Lucy stops just before reaching Talia, a look of familiarity on her face...
14311212111112122121212111.content:
Flipping to the next page in her book, Talia paused for a second.
"Like, odd..." She murmured, looking around. "Thought I heard something... Must've been my imagination!"
Looking back down at her book, Talia went back to reading.

If she had taken a proper look around, she would've noticed the picture book next to her was now glowing. In the gentle breeze blowing through the exposed balcony, the light cover fluttered slightly. However, as the wind slowly died down, the cover continued to flutter. It slowly got more and more vigorous until it flipped open, revealing a picture of a heavily pregnant Lady Lucy.

The glow of the book dimmed slightly, focusing in on the page. As the page glowed brighter, a dainty hand pushed out. A slim arm followed, a shoulder slowly forcing its way out of the page. The book shook slightly as a head phased out.

Finally! The ghost of Lady Lucy thought as her head looked around. Being confined to this book for centuries was unbearable! Another few years and I think I would've lost it... And who might you be?

Staring at the tubby girl sitting before her, Lucy cocked her head.
An odd dress sense, if I'm honest... And a little on the fat side... Oh, hang on... The way her belly curves like that... You aren't fat at all, are you? No, you're like me!

Planting her free hand on the bench, Lucy let out a grunt as she forced the rest of her body out of the page. Her other arm came easily enough, however her breasts and belly posed a problem. She wiggled her body, using what little strength she had push herself out.

With a long grunt, Lucy managed to free her upper body from the book. Her lower body slid out with little difficulty, allowing the pregnant ghost to float away from the book.
Finally! She thought. Now I truly am free from that book! Now...

"What the hell are you?!"
Hearing a scream, Lucy looked around. To her left, the pregnant girl sat, staring at her with mouth agape and eyes wide. The book she had been reading had fallen to the ground, where a few raindrops slowly landed on its pages.

"I am... uh..."
Hearing the spectral figure speak, Talia jumped to her feet. She scrambled backwards, trying to get away from them.
"S-Stay right there!" Talia ordered with a shaky voice. "Don't come any closer! I'll scream, I will!"

The ghost didn't move. Instead, she watched Talia with curious eyes, her hands folding under her belly. She floated patiently, seemingly obeying Talia's command. Talia took a deep breath, calming herself slightly, before speaking again.
"W-Who... What... Who are you?" Talia asked curiously.

"I am Lady Lucy Davis. A pleasure to meet you!"
Lucy made a clumsy attempt at a curtsy, her belly hindering her attempt.
"May I ask who you are?"

Talia's mouth moved wordlessly. She attempted to say her name, but found she couldn't.
An actual ghost... She thought. I though mum was making all that up! She doesn't seem to be hostile, thought... Should I try communicating?

"I-I am Talia Davis!" Talia finally answered, somewhat nervously. "Now, w-what are you? An actual ghost? Or is somebody playing a prank on me? If so, I'd like them to stop!"

Lucy shook her head.
"I am no prank, as you put it. I used to live in this mansion. However, after my child passed away, I..."
Lucy trailed off, tears forming in her translucent eyes.

Ghosts can cry? Now I've seen it all... Talia thought. "Like, I'm sorry to hear that. But why are you here? Why didn't you, you know... move on?"
Lucy wiped her tears away.
"I didn't want to..." She whispered. "I just wanted my child back..."

She looked down at her belly, tracing a finger over the top of it.
"I see..." Talia said. "Well, I don't really know how to help you..."
Lucy looked up, an odd expression on her face. It was sad, happy and wanting, all at the same time.

"I do..." She said quietly, floating towards Talia, who shrunk back.
"S-stay away!" Talia warned, reaching for the door handle. "I swear, I'll scream for help!"
Unfazed by the threat, Lucy refused to stop, drawing ever closer to Talia...
14311212111112122121212111.title: Face-to-face with Lady Lucy

choices: Talia agrees to host Lucy...
Talia refuses. Lucy is understanding...
Talia refuses. Lucy isn't pleased with her answer...
143112121111121221212121113.content:
As Lucy drew closer to Talia, she began to panic. She had done a little research into ghosts and whatnot, and while the vast majority of it was oddly fuzzy, one little bit of information floated to the front of her mind. It was not a reassuring one, and did nothing to calm her down. Rather, it only panicked her more.

What if she wants to possess me? Talia thought, her eyes wide. I don't want to lose my body to a ghost... I want to keep living!
Feeling the door knob behind her, Talia tried to leave the balcony. However, the handle seemed to be stuck, panicking her even more.

"No!" Talia screamed, turning her back to Lucy. "Let me in! There's a ghost out here! I don't want to be possessed! Please!"
Nobody came.
"Please... Let me in..." Talia cried, tears in her eyes. She spun back around, slumping to the ground.

Powerless to stop Lucy, Talia watched as a spectral arm reached for her head. A chill enveloped the back of her head as Lucy pulled her closer and closer. Talia closed her eyes, prepared for the worst...

"Oh?!"
The chill disappeared. Talia cracked an eye open. Lucy had retracted her hand, and was now staring at her with wide eyes.
"You... carry him..."

Lucy's voice was filled with wonder. Opening both eyes, Talia watched as Lucy crouched down in front of her, one of her hands extending towards her belly.
"I never thought... I'd see him again..."

Lucy's form flickered slightly. She looked at Talia, who reluctantly looked back.
"I... have a request for you..." Lucy asked quietly, a few tears rolling down her cheek. "It's a selfish one, but even so..."

Opposite her, Talia's head was a whirlwind of differing thoughts. A part of her wanted to run, while another wanted her to stay to hear out Lucy's request. In the end, she stayed. Reaching out her arms, she tried to pull Lucy into a comforting hug, however her arms phased right through her.

Lucy recognized the gesture, and managed a smile.
"Thank you, Talia..." She said. "My request is this. Within you is the ghost of my son, Benjamin... He didn't survive very long, succumbing to the cold winter... I wish to join him within you..."

Talia's eyes widened in shock. She had a ghost in her body?! When had that happened? And Lucy wanted to enter her body as well?
"Like, what happens to me if you... You know..." Talia asked. "Who controls my body?"

"You will, of course!" Lucy answered. "I'll just be a voice in your head... But you'd be in control. If you want me to be quiet, I'll be quiet. If you want my opinion, I'll give it. And when my son is reborn, I'll join him..."

"Wait, reborn?" Talia asked. "Are you saying I'm pregnant?!"
Lucy didn't answer, giving her a cryptic smile in response.
"Well, Talia? Will you allow me my request?"

Unhappy with the change of topic, Talia mulled over the request...
143112121111121221212121113.title: An odd request from a ghost...

choices: Talia returns to her books...
Talia doesn't feel much for reading...
Before she can move, Talia collapses...
1431121211111212212121211131.content:
A number of thoughts raced through Talia's head, some positive, some negative and some very, very negative. Agreeing to host Lucy might be beneficial to her. For all she knew, Lucy was incredibly smart and she could potentially help Talia with her studies. Plus, she would probably understand the mansion a lot better than her. With Lucy navigating, she could probably find any room she needed!

Then again, Lucy could be a hindrance. She had agreed to let Talia retain control of her body, but what if that was a lie to gain her consent? What if Talia agreed, Lucy did whatever she needed to to enter her body and then took control? What would happen to her in that case? Would she become the ghost, destined to float around the manor for all eternity? Or would she just disappear?

The thought of it made her shudder.
"I wouldn't be malicious, if that's what you are thinking".
Talia looked up at Lucy, who smiled back.
"Like I said, it's your body! I would not dream of taking it away from you! My only wish is to be reunited with my son. By hosting me, you grant me that wish".

Talia nodded slowly.
"Okay... I guess it would be okay..." She mumbled, pushing herself to her feet. "So, like, how do I host you? Do I have to give you permission, or..."

Lucy giggled.
"No, nothing like that! Just remain still. It is all up to me..."
Taking a deep breath, Lucy slowly floated towards Talia. As she drew nearer and nearer, Talia began to shuffle anxiously. Was this such a good idea?

Before she could answer that question, Talia felt a chill enter her belly. Looking down, she saw Lucy's pregnant belly pushing into her own. As she floated closer and closer, the rest to of her spectral form slowly merged with Talia's.

As Lucy's breasts phased into Talia's, Lucy leaned forward. Talia's face slowly numbed as Lucy completely entered her. Her vision darkened, causing Talia to stumble slightly. She fell against the door behind her, causing it to rattle loudly, and slowly slid to the floor.

For a few moments, Talia was completely blind. All she could hear was the rain against the wooden roof above her and the sounds of her own breathing. And then...

All done! You should be able to see now!
Hearing Lucy's voice inside her head, Talia let out a gasp. She had had her doubts about the whole thing, but now that it had happened, she was pleasantly surprised.

Staring at her reflection, even Talia, who had become somewhat denser and forgetful over her stay at the mansion, could tell that something was off. Stepping closer to the mirror, she squinted her eyes, trying to figure out what was different.

While Talia tried her best to spot the differences, the spirit of Lucy began to stir within her. While she was a spirit and technically didn't need to sleep, Lucy has missed the sensation of slowly drifting off into a peaceful slumber at night. After Talia had returned to her room, she herself had decided to rest and had quickly drifted off.

However, as she decided to slumber later than Talia, she had hoped to awaken later than her. Sadly, this was not the case as the amount of intense thinking Talia was currently doing had roused her from her comfortable slumber.

Letting out a yawn, which caused Talia to let out her own yawn a few seconds later, Lucy found herself staring at Talia's reflection. Two things began to worry her.

The first was the fact that she was looking through her host's eyes. While she had been commanding Talia around last night, the most she could do was sense her surroundings. For example, she could tell that a door existed in front of her, but not see it. Now, however, she could see the world clearly through Talia's eyes.

Which led her to her second worry, which were the subtle changes to Talia's appearance. While her host couldn't make them out due to how small they were, Lucy definitely could.

Before, Talia had been around half a foot taller than Lucy. Now, a quick glance at the hem of Talia's dress, which was closer to the floor, told her that she had shrunk slightly during the night, bringing her closer to Lucy's original height.

Aside from her height, there were some small changes to her face and hair. Her black hair was a little longer, now reaching down past her shoulders, and had taken on a lighter hue, looking blonde in certain lighting. And her round face had softened even further, making Talia resemble Lucy just that bit more.

This isn't good... Lucy worried. She may not remember me, but even so, if further changes to her body occur, she is bound to notice something is going amiss... I suppose, for now anyway, I should convince her to move on, least she figure out the differences in her appearance...

14312.content:
With a smile, Talia left the vast bedroom. A little exercise would be just the thing to work a bit of an appetite before the dinner Godfrey was surely preparing for her. As she wandered through the halls, the thought of actually needing a map began to emerge, first as playful musings, which began growing into awed whispers in her mind. As large as the mansion looked from outside, it was clearly a lot larger than even her wildest expectations.

At first, she walked down the halls, randomly opening doors and venturing into the rooms beyond if they caught her attention. There was just so much to see in the house, all of it decorated in exquisite taste. A vast library. An enormous veranda leading to the immense gardens. A domed patio overlooking a crystal-clear pool, a pair of inviting hammocks lazily swinging in the breeze. A drawing room. Talia actually giggled at seeing the last one. She'd always thought proper drawing rooms were places only the super-rich actually cared to have in their houses. Well, she thought, I suppose I'm someone like that now.

And that was only the doors she'd managed to open, since around half of the doors she'd tried were locked. She wondered what she'd find behind those tantalizing doors. Mentally adding a reminder to ask Godfrey for the keyring, she reached the great double doors at the end of the hall, opening them with a grand gesture.

What she saw took her breath away. It was a ballroom, a real, brilliant ballroom straight from a Disney movie. Chandeliers, smooth marble floors, a fireplace and immense windows overlooking the mansion's gardens. It was awesome, almost unreal. Talia could imagine the enormous parties the place could hold. She made a note to ask Godfrey or someone else about the place's capacity. Really, there was just too much for her alone. A couple of parties would really liven up the place. A place this big could get really cold and silent, and she'd always been social. Surely she'd find enough people for a nice shindig.

And then there was the bright white stone platform at the back. Talia circled it, scratching her head. It was a bit too small to be for dancing, too big to be a table. It was certainly eye-catching, though, neatly decorated with grape vines and images of an ongoing feast.

"Excuse me? Miss Talia?" A voice called her from the ballroom's entrance. A girl who couldn't be older than Talia herself, wearing an apron over a black sweater and jeans. "Sorry. I'm Janna. Mr. Godfrey sends me; dinner's ready to be served. If you'd follow me to the small dining room?"

Talia smiled. "Sure, thanks!" She began following the taller maid. "Hey, Tricia? Quick question. Did my grandparents have a lot of parties here?"

The maid thought for a moment. "Not so much in these last years, but Mr. Godfrey sometimes talks about this place's history, and he says that back in the sixties and seventies this place was huge in the social scene. I do know there were a couple of huge New Year's Eve celebrations, some marriage banquets even. The house still has a fairly large wine cellar, even though it must be at around half capacity or less these days. Your grandparents still received people every now and then in the smaller rooms, though it wasn't like the place must have seen in its prime."

"I see. And... what's that big stone platform in the place of honor?"

Janna frowned. "I'm not really sure myself. I think it was for some kind of display. Maybe it was the hosts' table or the buffet table or something. Really, I've only been there a couple of times to clean up. Like I said, I've never seen a party big enough to justify opening up and preparing the ballroom with all the bells and whistles. But I'm sure Mr. Godfrey has, so I suppose he'd know."

With that, they arrived at the dining room. Talia oohed and aahed at the steak dinner prepared for her, and hurried to take her seat. The smell wafting from the slab of meat was simply divine, and Talia wasted no time in cutting and savoring a piece. She moaned appreciatively as the meat almost melted in her mouth, leaving a thick, strong aftertaste in its wake. It had to be one of the nicest meals she'd been treated to, especially with the array of sides festooning the main course. There was a baked potato, bathed in rich creamy sauce, grilled broccoli, a couple of biscuits slathered in gravy, and of course, the delicious red wine.

Talia was in heaven. The meal was a bit like the house: it seemed just way, way too much for her. But it was just so good, all of it. She had to wait a bit every now and then, popping her jeans open and massaging her filling stomach, but the explosions of flavor just kept on coming. Buttery, sweet, salty, creamy. It blended into a feeling of luxury and comfort such as Talia had never known. Sure, she could leave the meal there, but hell, food was best fresh, and a big dinner every now and then was a peccadillo she was guilty of.I'll just ask for lighter meals from now on.

Talai leaned back in the plush dining chair. Had I lived with Grandpa and Grandma all these years,, Talia mused, I sure wouldn't have ever managed to fit into these pants. Not with this kind of food.

At long, long last, she managed to finish the last scraps of steak, down the last drops of wine from her glass, and sink into the softness. "Oof. Oh, God, Godfrey, that was great."

The aged manservant nodded. "And will you have dessert, Miss Talia?"

The girl jerked a bit. "Oh, no. No more, please. I'm sure it would absolutely dellish, Godfrey, but I just can't have another bite. Please tell me not all dinners will be like this."

Godfrey cocked his head a bit. "Well. Your grandparents did like to have a large dinner fairly frequently, but I suppose I should have asked how much you eat regularly."

"It's fine. Just, please keep to smaller, lighter meals unless I specifically ask for something special, okay? I've got a good metabolism, but I can't handle these feasts everyday." The butler nodded. "Oh, and..." Suddenly, a wave of warmth Talia had been ignoring washed over her with renewed heat. "Uff... sorry, I think I need to lie down for a bit."

"As you wish. I shall leave the keyring in the main lobby's table in the morning, so you can explore the estate at your leisure, though bear in mind most of the closed areas are extra bedrooms, so there's not much to see if you are to stay in the master bedroom. There are several buzzers around, so you can call either miss Janna or myself if you need anything,"

And with that, both servants gave a short bow, cleared the table and left, leaving Talia alone to nurse her food baby. Slowly, she made her way back to the master bedroom, and peeled off her clothes. For a moment, she considered taking a long bath in the enormous tub, but she barely had the energy to unpack her toiletries and wash her teeth before the heaviness of her huge meal became almost unbearable. Talia ruefully chuckled. Only once in a while, no matter how good this is...

She didn't even get to put on her pajamas before throwing herself on the bed. Talia was out like a light when she hit the pillow, not even bothering to cover herself.

Abdul wanted to rail against the accusations, but with a man speaking, these empty bodies were programmed not to interrupt. Even as he fought against the limits of the programming, he knew his defeat was inevitable. He'd watched the suffering on the face of his own harem girls too often to have any real hope. It was a sickening revelation to realise that he'd caused this coup. By delaying his transfer from his former body. Now, they had the evidence to show their father was no more. Their coup would succeed. The board shuffled, and glanced at their feet, accepting this and incapable of meeting Abdul's gaze.

Only the technician seemed more nervous than them... More nervous that Abdul, already guessing his disposal was needed to complete the overthrow.

As Abdul's gaze shifted to his daughter, he hoped for some empathy, for some pity. But, his daughter was stern-faced, and pitiless. Looking her former father over, her gaze lingering contemptuously on her too obvious bust, those horse-wide hips, and that immense equine ass she now carried behind her.

Their eyes locked, and she mouthed the words, "Better you than me." A placid, demure smile erasing her brief flare of anger. Her role as demure daughter back in place, and the obedient sister listening respectfully to her brothers.

"When I let you speak, you will answer politely, and respectfully, as a woman should when addressing a man." Samir said.

"Do you understand?" Mahmoud asked.

Abdul nodded her comprehension. Only to receive a dismissive shake of the head, from her sons.

"You have permission to speak, girl." Samir explained, in a weary tone.

"Perhaps, you could give her a new name, to help her adjust." Samira offered. Keeping her gaze respectfully low, she moved through the board members. Her eyes not firing any defiance, she reached her father. "She will be virtually immortal in that body now..." A smirk seeming to play over her face, at the observation.

A hand darting out, cupped, cradled and mauled her new bust. "She's a fulsome woman, she needs a name to reflect that."

Abdul fought not to gasp, first in pain, and then in arousal. Even that crude manipulation was enough to get her distracted. "Nahida, to reflect her new body."

Abdul could only fume, being named for her curvaceous, bountiful body. She wanted to curl up and die, as Samira turned to face the board. "Does this model come with full lacatation benefits?"

The board chatted, hurriedly in low whispers, before conferring with the technician.

"She can be upgraded for that..." The chair of the board, answered.

He hadn't expected his daughter to command this level of respect from the board, and saw in their faces that she, herself was held in lower regard. Her body defining her limitations, while Samira, was more modestly and properly attired.

With his humiliation over, and another worry added to her future. Adbul could only dread having to milk herself daily as Samira stepped back. Samir and Mahmoud seeming to take it as permission for them to continue. Surely, that couldn't be the case, Adbul thought.

But her attention snapped back to Mahmoud.

"We could keep you here under a watchful eye, or in your own harem." He mused. "Though we'd have to ensure the other... guests, didn't find out your original name, eh... Nahida!"

He felt a switch flip inside her head, She was now Nahida. Her name granted and confirmed, she was bound to answer to that.

"For a guarantee of silence and exile, we could allow you to live out your life in Paris." Samir offered, as a more palatable alternative. "Your guarantee would be enforced by the programming, ensuring you could never reclaim your former name, or even visit your homeland."

To be away from her treacherous, and treasonous family, Nahida would welcome the change in scenery. She wanted to leap on the second option, but a warning finger was raised. It's meaning too clear for her to ignore. She was rendered incapable of answering, and snapping their hands off in acceptance.

Samir muses about offering Nahida a further choice. An easy life as an exiled woman, pampered and supported in opulence. Or a life as a pauper, but in a male body, a foreign male body.

As Nahida reels at being dismissed as the head of the family. She sways back and forth, on the verge of fainting. His sons, talk quietly with the board, ensuring a smooth hand-over of power. Samira glances towards the technician, then approaches her father.

Taking her former father's arm, she avoids brushing against those extravagent hips, as she walks Nahida to the panoramic window.

"The Almighty chose you for that body..." She said, gently patting Nahida's arm. She gestured down to the holding area, at the end of the production line.

"It was that damned technician." She muttered back. Free to speak, since they were both women. Samira shrugged, "Sometimes, he works through low means."

"This is your achievement." she said her arm sweeping to indicate the whole floor spread out magnificently beneath them.

Nahida, still had certain instincts from being Abdul, and her gaze was drawn to the crowd of women milling aimlessly about at the end of the production line. They were penned up, in a temporary fenced off area.

Samira noticing, "Well, that's further proof of the Almighty's wisdom."

"They're operating under their basic programming. With their core personalities buried." Samira continued.

Frowning in confusion, gave Nahida a cutesy bimbo look, that his daughter quickly hid.

"What's wrong with them?" she asked.

"Well, depending on your perspective, Nahida." Samira clearly readying herself for some outrageous story, took her time to look him over.

"The technician didn't just save your mind, and transfer your consciousness into that... body." The pause, and the associated contempt was impossible for her to hide.

"Your memories are now the core personality for all of today's gynoids, fresh off the production line." Samira's expression shifted as comprehension slowly dawned on her father. Each one of them, had just as much claim to his wealth as she did.

Announcement

Hello!

Since you now have to have a membership to create new interactives, I’ve decided to simply overhaul Curve Controller to provide more options. I have condensed the most popular, well written, and longest existing storylines into one. I have edited a number of chapters as well as reposted a few, making sure to specify who wrote it in the new version. Several chapters did get deleted. If it was one of yours, I am sorry. The only ones I deleted were ones that were complete dead ends having never been edited or added onto since initial posting, those that have not been added onto for a very long time, poorly written additions, and additions that either disregarded previous entries or ignored continuity. Some were just lost in the overhaul. Again, I am sorry if yours was deleted. Hopefully you can find a place for it here once more. Anyways, I have to decided open this interactive up a bit more from the original one-character storyline. I hope to be adding more to it in the future myself.

Story

In this story you take on the role of one or more characters as they live their lives and go on adventures with weight gain and expansion themes.

Things that are ok:
• Female weight gain
• Female expansion (breast, butty, bell, hip, etc.)
• Male to female transformations. Bonus if it becomes M2BBW or they experience expansion.
• Bimbo transformations are encouraged (especially if you mix in things like male to female, weight gain, and expansion)
• Giantess, shrinking, and muscle are ok so long as it is nothing extreme (ie. No 100 ft or 2 in tall character, etc.)
• Pregnancy is ok but I’d rather it not be the main focus.
• Lactation is ok
• Age progression and regression are ok in small bits as long as it’s not the main focus. I don’t want old people or children being involved in most scenes so it shouldn’t last more than two or three chapters.
• Futa is ok
• Sex and graphic scenes are welcome

Things that are not ok:
• No blood/gore or killing characters unless absolutely.
• Nothing underaged. I will be very strict about this.
• No antrhos/furries please. There are plenty of stories in this site where you can find those.
• No scat/gas/toilet/etc. stuff.
• No male expansion. It’s fine if it becomes or is during a male to female transformation, but otherwise please no.

Finally

Please add at least one paragraph and use good grammar. I will edit chapters with poor grammar, wording, and layout if necessary. I will edit and/or delete chapters that do not make sense (ie. Really bad grammar or if they ignore story continuity) or if they break the rules. Feel free to email about anything!

Add and have fun!
